title: Comer Woods Walking Route

images.title: Roger Kidd / Coniferous Woodland, near Quatford, Shropshire
images.caption: Coniferous Woodland, near Quatford, Shropshire. Although this part of the wood is coniferous, there are some areas which are more mixed in character.

images.title: Roger Kidd / Footpath to the Pools, Comer Wood, Shropshire
images.caption: Footpath to the Pools, Comer Wood. The fields to the left contain cereal crops.

description: This walk explores Comer Woods in Shropshire. The woods are located just south of Bridgnorth on the edge of the historic Dudmaston Hall. You can start off at the Comer Woods car park at the northern end of the site in Quatford. From here you can pick up footpaths heading south east to a series of pools named Brim Pool, Seggy Pool and Wall Pool. The paths are well maintained with Deciduous and coniferous trees to admire. Also look out for a variety of woodland birds as you make your way through this peaceful area.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woods are ideal for dog walking. It's a popular place so you'll probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To extend the walk head to Dudmaston and explore the landscaped gardens and parkland surrounding the 17th century hall.

display_address: A442, Quatt Malvern, Quatford, Bridgnorth, Shropshire, England, WV15 6QL, United Kingdom
